title: Quantitative Analysis Strategies for Innovation and Performance Improvement in the Tourism Industry

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Learners must acquire practical knowledge directly applicable to establishing organizational innovation strategies as tourism sector administrators/leaders. Instead of developed-country cases, Latin American cases should be referenced to consider local contexts

learning_goals: The effects of process innovation and service innovation in tourism enterprises on performance can be analyzed using PLS-SEM methodology
The mediating mechanism of organizational learning in the innovation-performance relationship can be explained
A report diagnosing problems in the tourism industry can be prepared based on a quantitative research design
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
